definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
(idiom) to have a bad experience as a customer/to encounter poor service
to spend money on sth that turns out to be unsatisfactory or even disastrous

sentences.english: You can have a lot of fun for cheap close to campus.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在校园附近玩得很开心，而且花钱也不多。

sentences.english: Give them some money to take their younger siblings out for ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 给他们些零花钱，让他带着他的弟妹们去买些冷饮。

sentences.english: And to show my appreciation, I would like to pay for your first face-lift.
sentences.chinese: 为了表达我的感激，我愿意花钱请你做一次整容。

sentences.english: Hong Kong has three Banks issue currency, spend attention see denominations.
sentences.chinese: 香港有三家银行发行货币，花钱注意看清面额。

sentences.english: Xiao Zhimei served as the general manager of the high champion supermarket, wasteful spending.
sentences.chinese: 萧芝媚担任高尔佳超市的总经理后，大手大脚花钱。

sentences.english: Lili: George, how can we? Vacations cost money.
sentences.chinese: 乔治，我们怎么去得了？度假要花钱。

sentences.english: Make no expense but to do good to others or yourself; i. e. , waste nothing.
sentences.chinese: 花钱要花在利人利己的事情上，比如说，杜绝浪费。

sentences.english: I paid for the beers so I call dibs on the last bottle.
sentences.chinese: 我花钱买的酒，因此我有权喝最后一瓶酒。

sentences.english: And in that dream rich kids don't pay people to take the SAT.
sentences.chinese: 在这个梦里，富家子不花钱请人代考。

sentences.english: The thief gave himself away by spending so much money.
sentences.chinese: 这个小偷因大量花钱而露了马脚。

sentences.english: I used to spend all my pocket money on clothes and snacks.
sentences.chinese: 我过去常把我所有的零花钱花在衣服和零食上。

sentences.english: Every time I take him out,I have to dip into my pocket for ice-creams and toys.
sentences.chinese: 每次我带他出去，我都得花钱买冰激淋，买玩具。

sentences.english: I overspent my salary this month.
sentences.chinese: 这个月我花钱超过了我的收入。

sentences.english: Because of nonutility spends money lonely, very cheaply with regard to being able to.
sentences.chinese: 因为孤单是廉价的，甚至可以说不用花钱就可以得到。

sentences.english: Do you want to donate to your church or a favorite cause?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意为当地的教堂捐款或花钱学一门你最爱的课程？

sentences.english: Why not use the free stuff instead of spending money on the plastic versions?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不用免费的东西而要花钱去买塑料箱呢？

definition: variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
